item.title: The General Formula for Capital
item.description: Part 2: The Transformation of Money into Capital The circulation of commodities is the starting-point of capital. Capital arises from: the production of commodities their circulation as commerce Moderncapital begins in the global commerce of the 16th century.Money is the final material result of the exchange of use-values. Capital first appears in the form of money. As a matter of history, capital, as opposed to landed property, invariably takes the form at first of money; it appears as moneyed wealth, as the capital of the merchant and of the usurer.
